recipe.title: How to Cook Thin Sliced Chicken Breast

procedure.summary: Cut the thin-sliced chicken breast into 2 to 3 pieces, if necessary.
procedure.description: If the thin-sliced chicken breasts you bought are in large pieces, cut each into 2 to 3 pieces. Each piece should be about 2 inches (5.1 cm) wide. You don't need to cut the chicken if they were already cut into thin rounds or strips.

procedure.summary: Put the chicken on a tray and whisk the flour, salt, and paprika in a bowl.
procedure.description: Lay the thin-sliced chicken in a single layer on a baking sheet or tray. Get out a small bowl and put 1 tablespoon (8 g) of flour, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of hot paprika into it. Stir to combine the dry mixture.

procedure.summary: Sprinkle the dry mixture over both sides of the chicken.
procedure.description: Scoop up about half of the dry mixture and sprinkle it evenly over the chicken on the sheet. Flip each piece of chicken over and sprinkle the rest of the dry mixture over the other side.

procedure.summary: Slice half of a lemon and sauté it for 2 minutes.
procedure.description: Pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil into a large skillet and turn the burner to high. Cut half of the lemon into ⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) thick slices and add them to the skillet. Cook the slices for 1 minute and then flip them. Cook them for 1 more minute and transfer them to a plate.

Lower the seasoned chicken breast into the hot skillet so the pieces are in a single layer. Cook the chicken without turning it. The bottom should become golden brown. If you can't fit all of the chicken in a single layer, you may need to sauté them in batches.

procedure.summary: Flip and sauté the chicken for another 2 minutes.
procedure.description: Use tongs to turn each piece of chicken over and cook them on the other side for 2 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter while you make the sauce. The chicken should be completely cooked and reach 160 °F (71 °C) with an instant-read meat thermometer.

procedure.summary: Sauté the shallot over medium heat for 2 minutes.
procedure.description: Turn the burner down to medium and add 1 tablespoon (14 g) of the butter. Stir in 1 chopped shallot and cook it until it becomes clear.

procedure.summary: Add the wine and broth and boil the sauce for 1 minute.
procedure.description: Pour ⁄3 cup (79 ml) of white wine or dry vermouth into the skillet along with ⁄3 cup (79 ml) of chicken broth. Turn the burner to high and stir as the sauce comes to a boil. Keep boiling it until half of the liquid has evaporated.

procedure.summary: Stir the lemon juice and butter into the sauce.
procedure.description: Squeeze the juice out of half of a lemon and stir it into the skillet. Add the last 1 tablespoon (14 g) of butter and stir it as it melts.

procedure.summary: Serve the chicken piccata with strained sauce.
procedure.description: Place a fine mesh strainer over the platter of chicken and carefully pour the lemon butter sauce through it. The strainer will catch any seeds from the lemon juice and the shallot solids. Serve the hot chicken piccata with a side salad or cooked pasta. Refrigerate the leftovers in an airtight container for 3 to 4 days.
